customer_name: County of Monroe - Seneca Park Zoo

citations.narrative:
On Feb 12, 2023, at approximately 3:20am, while housed in his enclosure, the male 6 year old giraffe was able to get his
head through space (approximately 15”) between two supporting chute brackets. According to the facility records, when
he turned his head, his ossicones became stuck in the gate just below the opening. The facility staff found the animal with
his head caught in the space and a resulting cervical fracture. According to the Attending Veterinarian, the injury likely
caused very quick death. The facility has implemented corrective actions and has included preventative measures in their
plans to protect the three remaining giraffes. Indoor and outdoor housing facilities must be structurally sound and protect
the animals from injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On Feb 12, 2023, at approximately 3:20am, while housed in his enclosure, the male 6 year old giraffe was able to get his 
head through  space (approximately 15”) between two supporting chute brackets.  According to the facility records, when 
he turned his head, his ossicones became stuck in the gate just below the opening. The facility staff found the animal with 
his head caught in the space and a resulting cervical fracture.  According to the Attending Veterinarian, the injury likely 
caused very quick death.  The facility has implemented corrective actions and has included preventative measures in their 
plans to protect the three remaining giraffes.  Indoor and outdoor housing facilities must be structurally sound and protect 
the animals from injury. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
End Section
